channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Florida reels, focus turns to restoring power, assisting victims in Hurricane Milton's wake
item.description: Flooding is still possible in parts of the state as river levels are expected to continue rising into next week.

item.title: Hurricanes Helene, Milton walloped parts of the U.S. What will they do to GDP?
ECB is set to deepen global easing with rate cut it didn’t expect
item.description: The third quarter-point reduction of this cycle is seen likely by economists to herald a longer-lasting acceleration in cuts.

item.title: India is now Russia’s No. 2 supplier of restricted technology
item.description: The most recent data means almost a fifth of the sensitive technology that goes into Russia’s military-industrial complex got there via India.

item.title: Boeing to lay off 10% of employees, warns of quarterly loss and lower sales
UK leader Keir Starmer is marking 100 days in office. It has been a rocky ride
item.description: Starmer's center-left Labour Party was elected by a landslide on July 4, sweeping back to power after 14 years.

item.title: Elon Musk’s chances against OpenAI look grim as ChatGPT creator moves to dismiss second lawsuit
item.description: Accusing OpenAI of everything from fraud and racketeering to false advertising and unjust enrichment may look like the legal equivalent of throwing sp...

item.title: Federal Aviation Administration approves SpaceX Starship 5 flight
item.description: The FAA said SpaceX has "met all safety, environmental and other licensing requirements for the suborbital test flight."

item.title: Trump and Harris spending plans could be dashed by another ‘great bond massacre'
Lithuanians vote in parliamentary election with many looking for change despite a strong economy
item.description: Lithuanians voted Sunday in the first round of parliamentary elections that could lead to the center-right governing coalition being replaced.

item.title: Race season is here: here are the costs (literally and mentally) that go into being a long-distance runner
item.description: From trainers, vests, watches headphones, race places and more, running isn’t as cheap as you may think—not to mention the time and emotional costs.

item.title: China's consumer inflation cools in September, PPI deflation deepens
item.description: China's consumer inflation rate fell in September, while producer price deflation deepened, even as Beijing rolls out more stimulus measures.

item.title: ‘Chasing yield’ was an inside joke at SVB—until it led to the bank’s collapse
item.description: Back in 2011, some of the bank leaders were involved in running jokes about chasing yield—now they don't seem so funny.

item.title: Dow, S&P 500 close at record highs as stock investors cheer bank earnings
Here’s how stocks have performed under Biden-Harris vs. under Trump
